Title: Personalizing Your Images with AI-Powered Features
Abstract: Use AI for bulk image personalization, including smart crop and resize, background customization, object detection & captioning. For instance, dynamically determine orientation (profile or landscape) based on content, add sunglasses to faces & overlay captions matching the image's predominant color.

Title: Generative AI in Banking and Governance
Abstract: Join me as we unravel the potential, challenges, and ethical considerations of this cutting-edge technology (LLM) and how it is influencing the fabric of financial and governing systems. Last but not least, we will see how Python and its frameworks can be utilized to govern the operations of GenAI.

JobTitle1: Associate Director - Data Science & Machine Learning
Title: Neural Networks Unleashed: Python's Role in Shaping the Future of AI
Abstract: Dive into the future of AI with "Neural Networks Unleashed: Python's Role." Join me in exploring Python's pivotal role in shaping advanced neural architectures. From cutting-edge frameworks to real-world applications, discover how Python is driving the evolution of artificial intelligence.

Title: SuperDuperDB: Bring AI to your favourite database! Integrate, train and manage any AI models and APIs directly with your database and your data.
Abstract: Bring AI to your database. Instead of moving your data to complex MLOps pipelines and specialized vector databases, implement AI more efficiently. Integrate and train AI directly with your preferred database using only Python. This framework transforms your database into an AI powerhouse!

Title: Leveraging the Apache Flight Python Client and InfluxDB
Abstract: In this talk, we will learn about the advantages of Apache Arrow and Arrow Flight as a data format and framework for transporting large datasets. Then, we'll explore how to leverage the Arrow Flight Python Client to build an InfluxDB Python Client, work with Pandas and InfluxDB, and create a CLI.

JobTitle1: Developer Relations, Dev Marketing, and Community Programming
Title: Using Apache NiFi, Apache Kafka, RisingWave, and Apache Iceberg with Stock Data and LLM
Abstract: In this talk, we'll discuss how to use Apache NiFi, Apache Kafka, RisingWave, and Apache Iceberg to process and analyze stock data. We demonstrated the ingestion, processing, and analysis of stock data. Additionally, we illustrated how to use an LLM to generate predictions from the analyzed data.

Title: Building Apache NiFi 2.0 Python Processors
Abstract: Let's enhance real-time streaming pipelines with smart Python code. Adding code for vector databases and LLM.

Title: Empowering AWS DevOps with Python and Machine Learning: Real-Life Applications for Cloud Infrastructure Optimization
Abstract: Unlock the full potential of AWS DevOps with Python and Machine Learning! Join Gustavo Amigo, Senior Software Engineer at Prime Video, as he shares real-life examples of optimizing autoscaling, alarming, and cache configurations. Elevate your cloud infrastructure game with data-driven precision.

Title: Implementing a Virtual-Physical Environment Manipulation System based on ROS using Python and Three.js
Abstract: By leveraging Python+rosbridge and VueJS+Three.js, it becomes straightforward to create a ROS-based Digital Twins system. Through the integration of WebRTC and IP cameras, this system allows the operation and training of physical robotic arms on a cloud-based webpage, with Dockerization deployment.

Title: Build a Serverless WebAssembly App in Python using Spin
Abstract: Unlock the future of cloud computing with WebAssembly! Spin is the open-source framework to build serverless applications using Wasm. This talk is an introduction to how WebAssembly works, what makes it great, and how you can get started by building your first Wasm app using Python (+ a live demo!)

Title: Streaming DataFrames: A New Way to Process Streaming Data in Python
Abstract: Introducing an open-source library in Python: Quix Streams. It solves all the complexities of stream processing in a cloud-native package with a familiar Pandas DataFrame API interface and lets you work with streaming data similarly to static data in your Jupyter Notebook.

Title: On-Prem is the new Black
Abstract: The industry's general trend is shifting towards cloud repatriation, causing what I term a knowledge gap. In this talk, I aim to demystify on-prem environments and illustrate to engineers how straightforward and seamless it is to repatriate data from the cloud to an on-premises air-gapped environment

Title: Connected: Solving Real-Life problems using Python and Graph Databases
Abstract: Explore complex data with Neo4j, a graph database for managing intricate relationships. In my talk, I'll share cloud computing insights using Neo4j and show how to analyze network relationships with Cypher and Python's PyVis and NetworkX. You'll learn to apply graph theory with Neo4j and Python.

Title: Sketching Algorithms: Making Sense of Big Data in a Single Stroke
Abstract: What if you could take all your big data problems and shrink them down into small data problems so that you can process everything faster with less memory and constant query times? Data sketching applies theoretical math to computing to make slow big data problems into fast small data problems.

Title: Advanced API Design for Scalable and Fault-Tolerant Data-Intensive Distributed Systems
Abstract: As data-intensive distributed systems become increasingly prevalent in modern computing landscapes, designing robust and efficient APIs becomes paramount. The talk addresses the challenges of scalability, fault tolerance, and performance in complex, distributed environments.

Title: Using Vector Databases for Multimodal Search and Retrieval Augmented Generation
Abstract: Will discuss how to use multimodal embedding and large generative multimodal models that can see, hear, read, and feel data(!), to perform cross-modal search (searching audio with images, videos with text, etc.) and multimodal retrieval augmented generation (MM-RAG).

Title: Exploring the Latest Features of Python 3.12
Abstract: Take a deep dive into Python 3.12 and leverage its enhanced syntax, improved typing, and significant removals to optimize your code's efficiency.

Title: How to improve application and code quality without overengineering
Abstract: Developers often tend to overcomplicate the code. Consequently, customers do not always receive what they want. This approach is costly, time-consuming, and lacks support. I will share how you can effortlessly avoid these issues and create high-quality applications that genuinely satisfy the customer.

Title: Inside CPython: Navigating the Python Interpreter Source Code
Abstract: Explore CPython's internals in 'Inside CPython': a deep dive into its architecture, bytecode execution, and memory management. Uncover how Python's primary interpreter translates code to action, and learn to navigate its source for enhanced programming proficiency.

Title: Writing Python Codemods for Fun and Profit
Abstract: Do you want to automatically harden and improve your Python code? Are you struggling with processing the results of security and code quality tools? Come learn about the Python Codemodder framework: an open-source library for automating code quality and security fixes.

Title: Building modular plugin-based Python distributions with Plux
Abstract: This talk presents Plux, a dynamic code loading framework that does not rely on conventions, explicit code imports, or on manually declaring entrypoints. This creates an extremely easy-to-use and flexible way to declare and use plugins, and build modular & pluggable distributions.

Title: Data Radar Maps : A Snapshot of Your Organizational Data Framework
Abstract: We live in a world where we prefer trenches, whether it's business, tech, or data. Cross-trench communication is painful. I want to construct bridges between those trenches so that we understand each other better and build smarter products, more efficiently, and with a bit of joy!

Title: Python on AWS Lambda
Abstract: Learn how to build and deploy serverless apps with Python and AWS Lambda. I'll cover topics on writing functions, SAM for deployment, testing, and using Lambda Powertools for tracing, metrics, and moreâ€”everything you need to effectively run Python in Lambda.

Title: Functor Zoo
Abstract: Leverage the abstractions and composability of functors. Do you want to use covariant or contravariant functors to lift regular Python functions and compose them without side effects? Interested in building highly extensible and composable data pipelines with pro-functors? This talk will show you how.

Title: Unleashing the Power of Retrieval Augmented Generation to enhance AI-powered Applications
Abstract: More companies globally have started to utilize Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) to significantly enhance their AI-powered applications. In this session, we will take a closer look at how RAG works, and we will demonstrate how to implement a RAG-powered chatbot using Python.

Title: Visual Generative AI
Abstract: My research focuses on text-to-3D scene generation via voxel grid optimization. Broadly, this means creating software that generates fully interactive 3D scenes from text prompts. Iâ€™d like to talk about generative AI, my research, and the potential of AI-powered 3D workflows at a technical level.

Title: Iterate, Iterate, Iterate!
Abstract: The iteration protocol and generators are Python's power tools. Properly used, they allow for clearer code that is easier to debug and understand. The talk will cover the iteration protocol, generator functions/expressions, and the itertools and more_itertools libraries.

Title: Lessons Learned From Maintaining SDK in Python for Three Years
Abstract: Let's explore how to build an SDK that stands the test of time and garners adoption from other developers. We'll delve into proven patterns, examine the long-term impact of early-stage mistakes on the software, and discover strategies to introduce changes without breaking users' code.

Title: S, BB, X, Y, Z, a - a plethora of generations in Tech
Abstract: A slightly sentimental take on the topic of generational differences in the workplace applied to the IT industry. Most talks on this topic focus on proving that generational differences are myths or ignore that aspect and move on to listing those differences and tips. Here, I find a middle ground.

Title: Expertise in constructing extensive infrastructures and discerning their fundamental distinctions from smaller counterparts
Abstract: Explore the heart and soul of constructing vast infrastructures! Join me for a tech odyssey where scaling up isn't just a challengeâ€”it's an art. Unveil the magic behind building big, with relatable stories and real-world lessons. Don't miss the journey from small to colossal!

Title: Unlock the Power of LLM: Build a HuggingFace Agent
Abstract: Empower your projects with HuggingFace agents and tools! Harness the strength of transformers in multi-modal tasks. Choose from curated tools or seamlessly integrate your own. This talk equips you to hit the ground running. Elevate your AI game â€“ your readiness starts here!

Title: Python-Powered NLP Advancements: Leveraging LLMs for Enhanced Word Embedding in Classifier Performance
Abstract: Unleash Python's power in NLP! Dive into the dynamic world of Large Language Models to improve your classifier's performance. Join me to learn cutting-edge techniques, real-world applications, and Python's prowess in maximizing word embedding for unparalleled NLP advancements!

Title: Use of Python for Cutting edge Language Model research
Abstract: Join me as I share insights - from Financial Technology at Bloomberg to leading projects at Palantir Tech. Explore the pivot to LLMs, with a focus on Mechanistic Interpretability. Learn how Python, with its versatility, is the key to unraveling the potential of AI in shaping the future of humanity.

Title: Mastering Data Refinement: Unleashing the Power of SQL Queries in Python for CSV Filtering
Abstract: Dive into 'Mastering Data Refinement' with me! Learn to filter CSV data using SQL queries in Python, amplified by the power of the Polars package. Elevate your skills for unparalleled data analysis.

Title: Forecasting time-series with Polars and Deno
Abstract:
This session is a presentation of novel concept of time-series processing pipeline for MLOps

* polars for data modelling
* fast task running framework written in Deno
* WASM tasks in which we do forecasting

Focus on possible performance improvement in production deployments of time-series modelsâ€Ž â€Ž

Title: Building resilient applications - Implementing Hexagonal Architecture in Serverless Applications with Python
Abstract: Dive into the future of application development! Join me on an exhilarating journey as we unleash the magic of Hexagonal Architecture in Serverless realms with Python and AWS. Discover the art of building resilient applications effortlessly, turning complexity into simplicity.

Title: Code, Conquer, and Connect: Navigating Backend Engineering to Drive Revenue and Resilience
Abstract: Delve into the realm of backend engineering, from honing search algorithms that spike app revenue to pioneering AI-driven technical documentation and spearheading incident management teams. Reflecting a journey of continuous improvement, innovation, and substantial impact on organizational success.

Title: Securing Multi-SaaS Environments: A Deep Dive into our Robust Authentication Mechanism
Abstract: In the realm of SaaS, safeguarding data is paramount, and managing authentication for API calls to multiple SaaS providers poses a significant challenge. In this session, you will learn how we crafted a robust mechanism for securely storing tokens across multiple regions and tenants.

Title: Python Security Best Practices: Protecting Against Common Vulnerabilities
Abstract: In Python-powered software development, knowing and implementing robust security measures are paramount. Join me as we discuss protecting Python applications against common vulnerabilities, following a comprehensive guide and strategies against prevalent threats in the evolving cybersecurity landscape.

Title: A Python Sandbox for Dynamic Rule Execution
Abstract: Unlock business rule potential with a Python sandbox! Isolate, secure, and optimize performance. Forget Docker complexities. Choose thread/process wisely. Employ AST, Linux security, ulimit, Time Guard. Speed up with dependency preloading. Reuse the sandbox, reduce IO. Elevate your rule execution game!

Title: How to prove the safety of your software
Abstract: During shopping for food, consumers have the ability to learn what the contents of a package are before buying it by looking at the food label. Why not do the same and examine the ingredients of software before deploying or purchasing it? This allows you to assess the risks.

Title: How to use common Python frameworks to test Apache Airflow data pipelines
Abstract: You test all your apps; your data engineering and machine learning pipelines should be rigorously tested too! This talk will show you best practices and options to test Apache Airflow pipelines using common Python testing frameworks that can be integrated into a CI/CD pipeline.

Title: SQL Test Kit, or how to unit test any SQL query
Abstract: During this talk, we will present a simple way to unit test your SQL queries on BigQuery, applicable to any data warehouse and SQL dialect, using the [pypi sql test kit](https://pypi.org/project/sql-test-kit/)

Title: Building Authorization with Python: Dos and Donâ€™ts
Abstract: This talk will provide best practices for building authorization with Python. To do so, we will demonstrate how to use existing tools in the ecosystem: OPA, OSO, OPAL, Zanzibar, and others.

Title: Shadows of the past: figuring out how to deal with legacy
Abstract: In this talk, I'm attempting to systemize sources of legacy, methods for improvements, and tools related to Python systems. The previous version of this speech was Top-1 at Moscow Python Conf 2021. This time I made it even more detailed and useful.

Title: Probabilistic Programming in Python
Abstract: Unlock the power of probabilistic programming in Python with this presentation! Dive into foundational principles, explore Bayesian inference, and master PyMC3 for seamless implementation. From basic models to advanced techniques, simplify complexities for researchers and practitioners.

Title: Python as language of robotics
Abstract: There are different elements in Robotics that require coding and programming. Python can concretize the abstract algorithms for robotics or swiftly create a prototype. Therefore, I propose Python as the "Language of the robots."

Title: Navigating the New Internet: LLMs as the Key to Web4 Transformation
Abstract: Explore how Large Language Models (LLMs) are revolutionizing the internet, from transforming UI designs to driving environmental efficiency. Join us to uncover the future of digital communication with LLMs leading the Web4 era.

Title: Next-Generation PeT: Exploring the Future of Multi-Party Computation Software
Abstract: Dive into the future of privacy-enhancing technologies! Join me on a thrilling exploration of Next-Gen PeT, unveiling the Python-powered innovations shaping the evolution of Multi-Party Computation. A must-attend for Python devs eyeing the forefront of privacy tech!

Title: Don't work harder anymore; work smarter! How Python can handle and help you with repetitive tasks!
Abstract: Elevate your productivity with Python! Unlock the power of Python to conquer repetitive tasks! Join me at Conf42.com Python 2024 and discover how Python can supercharge your productivity! ðŸš€ #RPA #AutomateWithPython
